Classificrops¶

Each year, millions of croplands data are saved in national and regional Land Parcel Identification Systems(LPIS) to benefit from the Common Agricole Policy. The toolbox called Classificrops (Classification + crops) and developed in python (version 3.9.12) was built to facilitate the re-use of those data. For now, 3 tools are available in Classificrops : converter, optimal_threshold and view_stats. To know more about them, please read the documentation which is dedicated to users who have basic knowledges in python and in LPIS data.

This documentation is structured into 4 distinct parts :
  1. Tutorials

    Start here: Install the libraries, download the code and make your first conversion!

    In this section, you will be supervised with detailed instructions to learn to be familiar with the main function of the tool.

  2. How-to-guide

    Convert your national/regional LPIS classification to ICC, compare the handmade and the scriptmade results, visualize statistics on Occitania and Catalonia.

    Here, you will be guided to solve specific problem with series of short steps.

  3. Reference

    Read information about key functions.

    This part contains the description of Classificrops functions.

  4. Explanation

    Understand the context and the alternatives approach to LPIS data harmonisation.

  • 1. Tutorials
    • 1.1. How to install the toolbox
      • 1.1.1. Install
      • 1.1.2. Download the code
      • 1.1.3. Go to the scripts_Classificrops folder

      • 2.1.2. Rename the classification labels
      • 2.1.3. Go to the scripts_Classificrops folder
      • 2.1.4. Choose your inputs
      • 2.1.5. Run
    • 2.2. How to compare handmade and scriptmade conversion tables for a specific similarity method ?
      • 2.2.1. Create the handmade conversion table
      • 2.2.2. Choose your inputs
      • 2.2.3. Run

      • 2.3.1. Download the geo-data
      • 2.3.2. Go to the scripts_Classificrops folder
      • 2.3.3. Write paths into json
      • 2.3.4. Run
